post.description:
Lists controls from the last run, with optional filtering.
Supports filtering, but not pagination or sorting.
Limited to 100 results by default.

Authorization Action:
```
compliance:controlItems:list
```

get.description:
Show a specific node by ID.
Supports filtering by profile or control.
Does not support pagination or sorting.

Authorization Action:
```
compliance:reportNodes:get
```

post.description:
List all nodes, with optional filtering, pagination, and sorting.
Limited to 10k results.

| Sort parameter | Sort value |
| --- | --- |
| environment | environment.lower |
| latest_report.controls.failed.critical | controls_sums.failed.critical |
| latest_report.controls.failed.total | controls_sums.failed.total |
| latest_report.end_time (default) | end_time |
| latest_report.status | status |
| name | node_name.lower |
| platform | platform.full |
| status | status |

Example:
```
{
"filters":[
{"type":"environment","values":["dev*"]},
{"type":"start_time","values":["2019-10-26T00:00:00Z"]},
{"type":"end_time","values":["2019-11-05T23:59:59Z"]}
],
"page":1,"per_page":100,
"sort":"environment","order":"ASC"
}
```

Authorization Action:
```
compliance:reportNodes:list
```

List all profiles in use, with optional filtering.
Supports pagination, filtering, and sorting.
Valid sort fields: name, title

Authorization Action:
```
compliance:reportProfiles:list
```

List all IDs for the latest report for each node, with optional filtering.
Supports filtering, but not pagination or sorting.
Including more than one value for `profile_id`, or `profile_name` is not allowed.
Including values for both `profile_id` and `profile_name` in one request is not allowed.
Not limited to 10k results.

Authorization Action:
```
compliance:reportids:list
```

Makes a list of reports. Adding a filter makes a list of all node reports that meet the filter criteria.
Supports pagination, filtering, and sorting.
Limited to 10k results.

Valid sort fields: latest_report.controls.failed.critical, latest_report.controls.failed.total, latest_report.end_time, latest_report.status, node_name

Example:
```
{"filters":
[
{"type":"start_time","values":["2019-09-09T00:00:00Z"]},
{"type":"end_time","values":["2019-09-11T23:59:59Z"]}
],
"page":1, "per_page": 3,
"sort": "latest_report.status", "order": "ASC"
}
```

Authorization Action:
```
compliance:reports:list
```

Show a specific report by ID. Supports filtering, but not pagination or sorting.
Including more than one value for `profile_id`, or `profile_name` is not allowed.
Including values for both `profile_id` and `profile_name` in one request is not allowed.

Authorization Action:
```
compliance:reports:get
```

Get suggestions for compliance reporting resources based on matching text substrings.
Supports filtering, but not pagination or sorting.
`type` parameter is required. It must be one of the parameters from the following table.

| Suggestion type parameter | Suggestion type value |
| --- | --- |
| chef_server | source_fqdn |
| chef_tags | chef_tags |
| control | profiles.controls.title |
| control_tag_key | profiles.controls.string_tags.key |
| control_tag_value | profiles.controls.string_tags.values |
| environment | environment |
| inspec_version | version |
| node | node_name |
| organization | organization_name |
| platform | platform.name |
| platform_with_version | platform.full |
| policy_group | policy_group |
| policy_name | policy_name |
| profile | profiles.title |
| profile_with_version | profiles.full |
| recipe | recipes |
| role | roles |

Example:
```
{
"type":"environment",
"text":"aws*",
"filters":[
{"type":"start_time","values":["2019-10-26T00:00:00Z"]},
{"type":"end_time","values":["2019-11-05T23:59:59Z"]}
]
}
```

Authorization Action:
```
compliance:reportSuggestions:list
```

content.description: Exported reports in JSON or CSV.

options.description: The options defined for the attribute.

id.description: The unique ID of this control.

code.description: The full ruby code of the control defined in the profile.

desc.description: The full description of the control.

title.description: The compact description of the control.

results.description: The results of running all tests defined in the control against the node.

refs.description: External supporting documents for the control.

tags.description: Metadata defined on the control in key-value format.

waived_str.title: Indicates if the control has been waived or not

removed_results_counts.description: When the control results are removed to reduce the size of the report, this summarize the status of the trimmed results.

end_time.description: The time the report using the control was submitted at.

waivers.description: A list of waivers for the nodes affected by this control.

text.description: The term to use to match resources on.

size.description: The maximum number of controls to return (Default 100).

filters.description: The criteria used to filter the controls returned.

control_items.description: The paginated results of controls matching the filters.

control_summary_totals.title: The summary totals for this list of control items

total.description: The total number of controls in the report.

chef.automate.api.compliance.reporting.v.description: A minimal representation of the statuses of the controls in the report.

url.description: The URL of the profile accessible over HTTP or HTTPS.

path.description: The path to the profile on disk.

git.description: The git URL of the profile.

branch.description: The specific git branch of the dependency.

tag.description: The specific git tag of the dependency.

commit.description: The specific git commit of the dependency.

version.description: The specific git version of the dependency.

supermarket.description: The name of the dependency stored in Chef Supermarket.

github.description: The short name of the dependency stored on Github.

compliance.description: The short name of the dependency stored on the Chef Automate or Chef Compliance server.

status.description: The status of the dependency in the report.

skip_message.description: The reason this profile was skipped in the generated report, if any.

total.description: The total number of failed controls.

minor.description: The number of failed controls with minor severity.

major.description: The number of failed controls with major severity.

critical.description: The number of failed controls with critical severity.

id.description: The name of the file the controls are defined in.

controls.description: The ids of the controls defined in this file.

end_time.description: The time the report was submitted at.

status.description: The status of the run the report was made from.

chef.automate.api.compliance.reporting.v.description: A summary of the latest report for this node.

name.description: The name assigned to the node.

environment.description: The environment assigned to the node.

latest_report.description: A summary of the information contained in the latest report for this node.

tags.description: The tags assigned to this node.

profiles.description: A minimal representation of the compliance profiles run against the node.

nodes.description: The nodes matching the request filters.

total.description: The total number of nodes matching the filters.

total_passed.description: The total number of passing nodes matching the filters.

total_failed.description: The total number of failed nodes matching the filters.

total_skipped.description: The total number of skipped nodes matching the filters.

total_waived.description: The total number of waived nodes matching the filters.

default.description: The default value of the attribute.

chef.automate.api.compliance.reporting.v.title:
OrigWaiverData as it originally came from the InSpec report
Will supplement this with waived_str to make consumption easier

name.description: The name of the node's operating system.

release.description: The version of the node's operating system.

full.description: The combined name and version of the node's operating system.

chef.automate.api.compliance.reporting.v.description: The name and version of the node's operating system.

name.description: The name of the profile. Must be unique.

maintainer.description: The maintainer listed in the profile metadata.

copyright.description: The name of the copyright holder.

copyright_email.description: The contact information for the copyright holder.

license.description: The license the profile is released under.

summary.description: A short description of the profile.

owner.description: The name of the account that uploaded the profile to Automate.

full.description: The combined name and version of the profile.

depends.description: Other profiles that this profile depends on.

sha256.description: A unique value generated from the profile used to identify it.

groups.description: The groups of controls defined in the profile.

controls.description: The controls defined on the profile.

attributes.description: The attributes defined on the profile.

latest_version.description: The highest version number of the profile stored in Automate.

status.description: The status of the profile in the generated report.

skip_message.description: The reason this profile was skipped in the generated report, if any.

status_message.description: A message to detail the reason why a profile is skipped or failed in the generated report.

total.description: The total number of nodes matching the filters.

failed.description: The total number of failed nodes matching the filters.

skipped.description: The total number of skipped nodes matching the filters.

passed.description: The total number of passing nodes matching the filters.

waived.description: The total number of waived nodes matching the filters.

chef.automate.api.compliance.reporting.v.description: Stats on the statuses of nodes matching the filters.

status.description: The status of the profile run against the node.

full.description: The combined name and version of the profile.

status.description: The aggregated status of the profile across the nodes it has been run on.

profiles.description: Minimal representations of the profiles matching the filters.

type.description: File type, either JSON or CSV.

filters.description: Filters applied to the report results.

sort.description: Sort the list of results by a field.

page.description: The offset for paginating requests. An offset defines a place in the results in order to show the next page of the results.

per_page.description: The number of results on each paginated request page.

chef.automate.api.compliance.reporting.v.description: Sort the results in ascending or descending order.

ref.description: A description of the external document.

failed.title: The number of results with status of `failed` that have been trimmed (removed) from a control

skipped.title: The number of results with status of `skipped` that have been trimmed (removed) from a control

passed.title: The number of results with status of `passed` that have been trimmed (removed) from a control

end_time.description: The time that the report was completed.

status.description: The status of the run the report was made from.

environment.description: The environment of the node making the report.

profiles.description: The profiles run as part of this report.

job_id.description: The compliance scan job ID associated with the report.

fqdn.description: The FQDN (fully qualified domain name) of the node making the report.

chef_server.description: The Chef Infra Server that manages the node making the report.

chef_organization.description: The Organization the node belongs to.

roles.description: The Roles associated with the node.

chef_tags.description: The Chef Tags associated with the node.

projects.description: The projects the node is assigned to.

end_time.title: The time in UTC that the scan was completed

ids.description: The list of unique report identifiers found matching the query.

report_data.description: The list of unique report identifiers with their respective end_time, found matching the query.

reports.description: Paginated results of reports matching the filters.

total.description: Total number of reports matching the filters.

run_time.description: The time taken to run the test.

start_time.description: The timestamp of when this individual test was run.

message.description: The reason the test failed, if any.

skip_message.description: The reason the test was skipped, if any.

ref.description: The source code file the control is defined in.

line.description: The line number the control is defined on.

duration.description: The duration of the report's generation time.

text.description: The content that matched the search term.

id.description: The ID of the resource that was suggested.

score.description: The confidence in the match quality.

type.description: The type of resource to get suggestions for.

text.description: The term to use to match resources on.

size.description: The maximum number of suggestions to return.

filters.description: The criteria used to filter the suggestions returned.

os_name.description: The name of the supported operating system.

os_family.description: The wider category of supported platform (e.g., linux, windows).

release.description: The specific operating system release number this profile supports.

inspec_version.description: The supported inspec version for this profile.

platform.description: The platform name and version combined.

waived_str.description: The waived state of the control item. Possible values: `yes`, `yes_run`, `no`, `no_expired`.

expiration_date.description: The expiration date for the waiver. After this date, the control is no longer waived.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.
